website_summaries.verdict: If you're on a budget and tired of dealing with persistent dead zones in your home, this router will give you a solid and reliable connection where you need it most.
pros: Powerful antennas provide WiFi coverage in hard-to-reach areas
Gigabit ethernet port for a lightning-fast connection
cons: Does not feature any USB ports

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement
customer_reviews.text: A very much needed improvement over the older 2 netgear AC 750 router. I primarily used wifi accept my security cameras so I can't give you feedback on that speed, but my wifi went from 60Mbps to over 200 and a much stronger signal throughout the house with external antennas unlike there netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: No for Comcast/Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with comcast/Xfinity. wasted 4 hours troubleshooting. Not even Amazon customer service could get the TP Link on the phone. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thereault

customer_reviews.title: Wired ports are useless without internet. - UPDATE: stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: Sometime today (7/15) it decided to not connect to the modem. Checked with ISP, modem is great, connecting laptop to modem works fine. Talked to (very nice) TP-Link tech support, factory reset router, still will not accept IP address from modem, so no internet. Won't recognize wired clients. Original review: The ethernet ports stopped passing traffic after 24 hours of operation. Updated firmware, reset the device twice. It only recognizes DCHP clients on the wired ports, fixed IP devices disappear. UPDATE: Suddenlink has their head up their ass and we don't have internet, but I had the modem connected to the WAN port. Disconnected that, and the rest of them work now. SMH
customer_reviews.author: Graham Gibby

customer_reviews.title: Provides fast wifi speeds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to boost my existing wifi signal and configured it to be a bridge. Works perfectly, and I'm getting 100Mbps (the speed I'm paying for) in most areas of my home now.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Morgan

customer_reviews.title: App is worthless.  ##UPDATE DIED 370 DAYS
customer_reviews.text: Let's get the stupid out of the way. Some idiot thought wrapping the antennas in some hard plastic that requires a razor to cut off is a good idea. The side ones can unwrap like a thick saran wrap, but the back two have to be cut off. WTF. Next the app that they suggest using does not initial consider AP mode as an option. This was annoying. The App is completely useless. Right now it will allow me to see the AP via the app but you can't get any info from it. Not its IP address or any configuration other than setting the SSIDs.
customer_reviews.author: IamYourGod

customer_reviews.title: Bargain for the performance!
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved to my new apartment and the internet router was a bit of an issue. I called the wireless company to come check and they said that the router is too old. I would constantly get 3-5 mb on a 300mb internet pack. Was then looking on Amazon on a good product that can upgrade my internet. Came across this with 10$ off coupon and so far been super happy. Really easy to set up and their android app is useful. Now I'm constantly getting 110-120mb so it has been a bless. The router looks nice and the package is great. At lower than 40$, this is a good price.
customer_reviews.author: ConsultantinNY

customer_reviews.title: Slower Than My 2004 D-Link Router
customer_reviews.text: High hope for all the positive review. Once I got this router, I switched out my 2004 D-Link router and hoping to get better speed but to my disappointment this router keeps dropping. If I have more than 3 devices connected to it, the max speed I get is 18mbps. Range is terrible, if I'm 10 feet away from router speed drop to 10mbps. When I connect my 2004 D-Link router back as main router, speed up to 98mbps. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Xao Xiong

customer_reviews.title: great Xfinity rental replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (along with a TP-Link DOCSIS 3.0 16x4 modem) to replace my Xfinity rental modem in Chicago in June 2019. It has been working great to support my plan for 60mbps. Although I briefly had a 175mbps connection before I switched to a lower speed, and it handled that fine as well. Easy to setup with the app from the apple app store. There is a website to set it up as well but i used the app route. Great way to save on the xfinity monthly rental bill!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W

customer_reviews.title: Big waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: This product is so bad, the signal kept on failing all the time, called my internet provider and everything was fine on their end but it was the router that was not working properly, tried to reset it and get help from customer service but nothing worked. do not buy it, big waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Jovani

customer_reviews.title: The best router we have ever used in our house
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for a vacation rental property. A trailer, its doing great with 3 cell phones , laptop, and smart TV. We then installed another in our home 4 computer, 3 cells, 3 rokus, and Xbox. it has doubled our speed and handles multiple users better than the modem Frontier supplied us. I have a shop about 100' ft away through 2 walls and can watch videos or do anything with my desktop computer on WI-fi. Easy set up for a novice and I have already started telling my friends, thanks for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Impressive speed and coverage
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good router and a big upgrade from the Linksys EA4500 I had before. No idea what that top one-star review is about. Working fine with Optimum service, no drop in connections so far. Getting 100 Mbps download speed (wifi and wired) on all my devices which is what we are paying for. I like the web the mobile app interface, makes managing the router very simple. To get full advantage of this router's 5ghz band and MU-MIMU feature, make sure your client devices have AC WiFi otherwise you won't see any difference. Will update this review if any issue arises.
customer_reviews.author: Fatin Nabil

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have 200mbps service from Xfinity. If I hard-wire I get over 200mbps on speedtest.net. If I am 3 feet from the router and on the 2.4ghs channel, then I only get 80mbps; on the 5ghz channel I reach the same speed as being hard-wired. If I am 50 feet from the router and on the 2.4ghs channel, then I only get 30-40mbps; on the 5ghz channel over 100 mbps. Looks like a solid router for the price if you live in a smaller space and can rely on the 5ghz channel. If you have a larger home and need the 2.4ghz channel, then the speed drop-off is pretty large.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Four Antennas and Four Ports
customer_reviews.text: Four ports for wired connections and four adjustable antennas for WiFi. There is a button on the device to turn off the WiFi capabilities. There is also a nearby power button that I've accidently pressed a few times trying to turn the WiFi off. Perhaps a design flaw but also my fault. Easy to read connectivity lights. You'll have to buy your own cable to connect to the modem as the one provided with this product is very short. The plug is a vertical power box.
customer_reviews.author: Justice107

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 ghz does not work...outdated firmware.
customer_reviews.text: 5ghz works super fast. No connection issues no congestion at all. Multiple devices still blazing fast. 2.4ghz band worked for a couple of hours then will not work until either you change the channel or ssid. Then it will work for about 1hr and quit again. Nothing will connect to 2.4ghz, wired is good. I will be ordering something else since there are no firmware updates and 2.4 is not working. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Impressive signal strength and coverage
customer_reviews.text: Update: The reason for 2 signals showing in the WiFi options is for general wifi speed at 5gh and the 2.4 speed for computers. You are also able to set up another WiFi signal for guests. So far there has not been one dropped signal. No dead zones anymore. Right out of the box this router gave me a solid signal throughout my home and even in the garage where I would typically lose signal. The physical setup was very easy. The mobile setup was a little tricky as the signal shows up as two signals. Tp 2.4 and to 2.4-5. Overall, the signal is stable and very strong. No more amber lights on the modem or router.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Terrific performance
customer_reviews.text: This router has been a fantastic upgrade that gives us 100mbps WiFi speeds. It does have two bands, a slower 2ghz band with longer range and a faster 5ghz band with shorter range. I recommend naming the bands differently. When they are named the same, your devices will have a tendency to connect to the stronger but slower band. By naming them separately, you can ensure that your compatible devices connect to the 5 ghz band. Even with this setup, older devices like a 2ghz chromecast are visible on the network.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Good router for me so far
customer_reviews.text: For a single bedroom apartment, I've only had this for a few days but I'm satisfied so far. I get over 200mbps speeds on my wired device, between 115-200mbps download speed on 5ghz wifi (traveling to a device through bathroom and kitchen) but only about 42 download at best on the 2.4ghz band I pay for 200/10mbps down-up and it's just me in the household most of the time so this is good enough. No lost signal yet but at the farthest end of my apartment the signal does drop a bar (wall interference is not good for 5hz)
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: I now have WiFi end to end in my home!!
customer_reviews.text: My Belkin N600 router has been getting more problematic over the past six months where I would need to reset it a few times every day. My N600 would only show full strength on my android phone when I was 10-15 feet away or closer, in the same room as the router. This TP-Link Archer 6 router will show full strength on that same android phone everywhere in my two story house... very impressive! Now we can stream video on three devices along with audio streaming without the router needing rebooting or that annoying "buffering" during that great movie. I am very, very happy with this router!
customer_reviews.author: Frank A

customer_reviews.title: User interface is ok and it “works” ok, but range sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy it again. Range stinks. I would return it if I still could. My mistake waiting too long. Works ok If walls or distance is not an issue and set up is easy but DO NOT get this if range is an issue. I have it upstairs in a 2 bedroom condo and it routinely disconnects when I’m downstairs on my iPad and it routinely disconnects from my nest cam that is out on my garage just 30 feet away.from it.
customer_reviews.author: jagpilot

customer_reviews.title: Advertises range, doesn't deliver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my current router signal does not reach to the end of my house where my bedroom is. I bought this because it was on sale, and it touts it's range for both bands on the router (both 2.4 and 5 ghz bands), however, it had worse range than my current device (which I bought for around $30 at Walmart). Needless to say, returning this and sticking with my old device until I find something better. If you want this for the range, I can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rheanel Breshears

customer_reviews.title: 6 months later and the wireless is no longer reliable.
customer_reviews.text: THE GOOD: The user interface is good, you can use a browser to make setting changes to this router, contrary to what they suggest. No need to register and use the other system, which would be useless if you had connection issues. It is full featured and has controls and settings for most anything. I won't bother with details here. THE BAD: Lately I have had to reboot the router to get wireless to work. It fails now with regularity. I will have to return it, and have no confidence that the replacement will be any more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good at going through walls
customer_reviews.text: I don't have access to very high speed internet, so speed was not my concern. The router is located in a 50 year old addition to the main house. The addition is covered on three sides with aluminum siding. The remaining side is 50% blocked with a brick wall, the rest is open to the kitchen. The router is located on the wall farthest from the rest of the house--an undesirable location. I was looking for a router with a signal that would penetrate the various walls. The signal from this router reaches every room in my 2000 square foot home. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and great range.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace a Netgear wireless router I used as an access point. This router I am also using as an access point. I noticed that the 5 GHZ band has more range than my Netgear router did. I had to reboot my Netgear router sometimes as often as three times a day because it would stop responding to my wireless devices. I have never had to reboot this router since I installed it. The only times it wasvrebooted was when my power went out and came back on. It was easy to setup and configure. I would recommend this router to anyone that needs a dependable router.
customer_reviews.author: M. Swanby

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love
customer_reviews.text: This beautiful little spaceship is amazing! Especially for the price. I have family with $300 routers that don't stand a chance against this bad boy. Increased my range, speed and bandwidth by a huge margin. Also, you can download the app and program parental controls to individual devices, monitor who is on at any given time, run Diagnostics from outside of the network (in case you're at work and a spouse, child, visitor, etc. can't get the internet to work) and so much more (yes, that was meant to sound like a cheesy late night add. But it's still true!) Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Benfield

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This router is excellent so far! Able to manage multiple devices using large amounts of bandwidth -- tested streaming HD video to 3 devices simultaneously without any hiccups, buffering, etc. The router's user interface is also very easy to use and setup was simple. One minor gripe: this router was a bit larger than I was expecting/imagining... I'm sure the dimensions given on Amazon are accurate but it's just larger than my previous routers. But this is a minor quibble, I'm very happy with its performance and signal strength, and would recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable router!
customer_reviews.author: Nosajat

customer_reviews.title: Simple to add 5GHz to my network
customer_reviews.text: My old wifi router was just 2.4GHz. I wanted to add 5GHz support when I cut the TV cable and started streaming everything. This router was relatively inexpensive, seamlessly plugged into my modem and configured to my existing 2.4 GHz parms. 5GHz configuration was equally as simple. The TP-Link Tether app is good for making any changes. But, most importantly, I'm just able to ignore everything because it hasn't skipped a beat since the day I plugged it in. Oh wait, I did have to push the WPS button on it when I got a wifi extender to boost the 5GHz signal for a downstairs TV... and everybody stayed happy.
customer_reviews.author: Happy CamperTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: review - TP-Link AC1200 Gigabit Smart WiFi Router - 5GHz Gigabit Dual Band MU-MIMO Wireless
customer_reviews.text: Review - The TP-Link AC1200 Gigabit Smart WiFi Router - 5GHz Gigabit Dual Band MU-MIMO Wireless - This router is working well for me. I have the router input attached to the output of an Arris cable modem. I have one of the wired outputs on this router connected to a 50 ft cat7 cable that is connected to a netgear gigabit wired router. - I am getting smooth 500mbps wired throughput to my computers out of the attached netgear router. - The wireless support is providing good connection to my various mobile devices, samsung android tablet, and various iPhones - Everything provided plug and play setup. - All is operating smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your router doesn’t lose its PW
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Lost its PW and was told only way to recover it was to put the ether net cable into a computer that I could not do. Just moved have no access to my computer and usually use only my iPhone. It will now be thrown away. BTW didn’t actually lose PW the router lost it I knew the PW the router just would no longer take itz
customer_reviews.author: Ladygem222

customer_reviews.title: No MAC filtering when in Access Point mode
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use as an access point. Sad to see that when you set it as access point, you lose a lot of security functionality. It appears that MAC filtering is a feature they've locked to when the device is in default router mode. But once you switch it to AP, you aren't able to MAC filter. This was very disappointing to discover. Besides that, the packaging was nice. The router is decent looking enough. I haven't really used it more than for my own purposes, and was sad to see, like others have said that there is no third party firmware support for this to get around the loss of security functions.
customer_reviews.author: Am Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent General Purpose Router
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired network technician so I've installed a lot of routers. I have always preferred TP-Link and Netgear routers and in this case the TP-Link was the right choice. The home was a single story, about 2000 square feet, with the router at one end of the house. Signal strength was excellent over the whole house with very little loss of speed regardless of distance. Set-up was extremely easy. The router's default settings are perfect for 90% of general purpose users but the router is easy to reconfigure if need be (VPN's, Gamers, etc.). For a general purpose router for Internet access and Netflix streaming the TP-Link AC1200 is an excellent value. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Marty913

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: A router is a router. But this one has somewhat larger antennas, and seems like radiation coverage is a strong as it can be given the amount of power it generates. The real test is when you see decent signal after going through several drywall walls. In my set-up it does perform better than others costing quite a bit more. Full of features such as UPNP and easy to set-up. I recommend it because is a very good deal for your money. So far TP Link lives as to expectations even in customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted. Exactly 6 months later, device died!
customer_reviews.text: The router was working fine. Many options to even have wifi-extended assess points. MU-MIMO was a plus. Many functions with easy-moderate user interface. All was good until the device suddenly died today! Power cable replacements with the ones I have could not revive it. Definitely not a power cable issue. It died the most awkward time too around 11:30 PM and got me running around digging through storage for old router to replace ASAP. Netgear has always lasted long and strong. My replacement from storage was a 5-6 years old netgear dual band (that had been great to us few years prior "its retirement"!). Time to shop for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: KMK

customer_reviews.title: Poor excuse for a routing AP
customer_reviews.text: I am going to say I have configured and used a lot of network devices. This by far was the worst for a home product. The configuration menus were basic and took some deciphering to get right. Performance was lacking and constant disconnects unlike any other product I have bought. Price was reasonably the same as other brands, but I chose this one as it was in stock and faster delivery. NEVER AGAIN. This brand is definitely off my list of things to buy again and all the people I talk to with will get a negative review of this device and brand. I will stick to a more stable brand I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfect, no speed drop!
customer_reviews.text: this worked perfect in our office, no speed drop, set up took literally less then 5 minutes from the time I opened the box, until I was up and running. No issues at all, has not dropped a single connected device or required reset. I definitely recommend this at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Just trying to help =)

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal and awesome range.
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome router! Gigabit ethernet and I get my full 150+Mbps over 5Ghz. The signal covers my whole entire apartment unlike my other router. The app for your phone is non intrusive and informative. All in all a very well built router. I disabled all the extra "security features" and voice recognition crap and haven't upgraded the firmware as I want it as bare bones as possible. I didn't think it was going to that much of an improvement over my old router but it blows my old router out of the water when it comes to range, latency, and features. The photo attached is from an area in my room my old router used to struggle in.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Great router with fast speeds
customer_reviews.text: A good router makes a lot of difference on what speed you get out of your inherent connection. I had a conceiting with guaranteed 100MBPS speed but I was never getting more than 60-70 MBPS with my old router. A friend suggested me to get this one and it made a huge difference to internet speed. Now I get speeds above 100MBPS, sometimes even going to 130MBBPS. The installation is easy. Dual band with 2.4GHZ and 5 GHz is very handy for nearby and far internet connections. The app is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Not for 1000Mbps speeds
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my wifi to 1Gbps and quickly realized that the so called GB ports do not have an output capable of 1000mbps. My modem can handle the connection directly. Just for fun I ordered an Asus router and hardwired using CAT6 cables. Only then i was getting the speeds i was paying for. Its a good router, don't get me wrong. Coverage is excellent on my 1500 sf home. Covers my backyard too. But if you are wanting to upgrade to faster internet anytime soon. I would not recommend. Tops speeds for this router hardwired with CAT6 is around 300Mbps. Wifi average speeds 150-200Mbps
customer_reviews.author: Rudy G!

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage throughout the house
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a replacement for the wireless router that Verizon provided for our Fios internet. The Verizon router did fine on the first floor, but had a lot of trouble reaching the second floor. The TP-Link router has great coverage throughout the whole house, and we're very happy with the signal strength. The setup is also super easy. Simple plug the router into your terminal, browse to a web address provided in the instructions, and chose a name and password for your new network. I had it up and running in about five minutes, and most of that was choosing a funny name for the WAN.
customer_reviews.author: thomas.galvin

customer_reviews.title: Great value and sturdy performance for a fair-priced router
customer_reviews.text: Installed with the Tether App from TPLINK. Easy install. I added a TPLINK extender and it worked seamlessly with the router to create a mesh network. Brilliantly made, great value. It’s not a monster broadcast with just the base unit but it’s plenty capable for most uses. If you plan on having a larger family or possibly customers on your Wi-Fi you would do yourself a favor to bump up to the higher end AX/WIFI6 router which should handle a larger number of devices simultaneously. Otherwise, this is a nice unit with expansion capabilities using the extenders from TPLINK which I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C&K

customer_reviews.title: Very slow wireless, it pro here.. Avoid this one
customer_reviews.text: I am an it pro with a baccalaureate degree in data communication. I set this up in my house and got 15% of the throughput of the ISP provided router I had. In other words my WiFi throughput went from 320Mbps to 60Mbps on 5Ghz band, avoid this router.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan McCalley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and solved my problem!
customer_reviews.text: This one literally saved my family. We have 3 kids and two adults work/school from home with Zoom meetings. We have this intermittent Internet issue for months. Called spectrum customer service, changed different spectrum routers, asked on-site technical support... No use at all! Finally I decided to try different router. We have used this one for a week and so far it works amazing. Every one is happy with the Internet. I will keep monitoring the performance. If I didn't return with any other updates you know the router still works great. BTW, the price is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Iamsofancy

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the reviews on this router so I ordered it. After hooking it up the unit would turn off immediately as soon as I released the power button. I returned it and requested another identical unit. It was shipped out immediately. I hooked it up and this one works perfectly! I respect companies that stand behind their products and this one did exactly that. I’m glad I chose this router and I would recommend it to anyone who wants good service and a router that is easy to connect and delivers plenty of power throughout my house.
customer_reviews.author: Richard N Cary

customer_reviews.title: Fast, inexpensive, gigabyte, 2k 5k router or so I thought......
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. Starts out fast with in days it slows to dial up speeds. I have exchanged it ounce. Only to have slow internet, disconnection devices. Amazon nor TCP-Link will make this right. Forget this product. Buy a Dlink
customer_reviews.author: SoCalT

customer_reviews.title: WOW! So Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a NetGear WNR2000 to this TP-Link AC1200 and I was surprised to see how much the WiFi signal improved! I'm signed up for Cox Communication's 150 Mbps plan and I'm actually getting the full 150 Mbps on WiFi (yes, on WiFi, not hooked up via ethernet). My NetGear was giving me only 50 Mbps on my Samsung Galaxy Note 9 and about 80 Mbps on my HP Envy x360 15" (2020 model). Now I get the full 150 Mbps on both devices! (Of course, speeds will vary depending on your devices' proximity to the WiFi router.) Overall, I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: so far..
customer_reviews.text: seems to work great, we got a new internet provider thats why we needed to buy our own, so I don't really know if when we have bad service if it's this or the service itself, my guess is the service. I REALLY love the phone app for this! I can now put the smackdown on my youngest who will try to sneak a laptop or whatever at night in her room, the app is a G-R-E-A-T feature, U can control it by device or person/profile, u can also just shut the internet off at night if u like, I LOVE THAT! Haven't needed to contact tech support so, no review on that.
customer_reviews.author: SatanKitty

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer.
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR: The thing works! the MU-MIMO features really makes the connectivity STABLE as it can be, important when you have a lot of devices connected (Tv's, Bulbs, Cameras, Smart Speakers, Laptops, Etc). My home is not HUGE, but for some reason I had place my Modem/Router at one end of the house, and my office is located on the other side. Even though the signal was full bars with my Comcast/Xfinity modem. I couldn't have a stable videocall, our smooth navigation, without having to turn my Wifi Off/On. After the TP-LINK all my issues with my internet connection are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Montero

customer_reviews.title: Very poor technical support. Don't be stingy and invest more to avoid such a horrible experience.
customer_reviews.text: Bought several TP-link products in the past. It's inexpensive and it works. But after the experience I had with their technical support, I've changed my mind. I'm an IT professional with 10+ years of experience in networking. I've troubleshooted the device and determined the cause to be faulty internet port. provided all the troubleshooting steps I've performed. enough information for any IT personnel to come to the same conclusion. Long story short, the technical support agent gave me an unnecessarily hard time, lectured me on what situation I'm in. Just a horrible experience. Don't be stingy. Let's spend a little more and get a product from a manufacturer whose technical support you can depend on.
customer_reviews.author: Min Kang

customer_reviews.title: Sent to wrong address, replacement sent  and it fail to work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: the first router was sent to the wrong address and another was sent out as soon as I let Amazon know it had been sent to a different address. I needed this router and the second one arrived a week later, wasted no time in setting it up, It worked great at first on the wireless part then quit after only three hours, tried the hard wire it fail to work also. It showed up on the wireless devices but fail to connect. I've installed many routers over the years and never had any problem. Amazon response was great, I just need to look for a better router
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising.  Not 1G WiFi!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable router that works, however the description is misleading. This IS NOT a gigabyte WiFi router. It fooled me by suggesting it’s for 1gb/s Wifi rout when it actually means that it is at best capable of 867MB/s on 5.8G network and 300MB/s on 2.4G network witch is used more commonly. Only the ethernet plug is capable of 1g but no need for router there. It’ll do until my real 1g router comes in. I will be more careful next time and will never buy TPlink again
customer_reviews.author: Casey Vick

customer_reviews.title: Good WiFi signal
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to decide to buy this! It is cheap compared to other wifi routers I was looking at, and it has all the features I am looking for. I get it the second day (Thank you Amazon !). It took me 30 minutes to set it up, and 20 minutes was trying to figure out why it is not connected to the internet --- I forget to restart my modem. haha. It is the first time I understand the modem, router, extender ... Now I don't need my extenders, I can get a very good signal everywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: J. W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well. App makes set-up easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the FIOS Router that was no longer provided free as part of my bundle. Faster than theirs, and very easy to set up and use. The Tether App made set up very straightforward. Thanks to the features and tools this router is a big upgrade from the FIOS one and it pays for itself in just a few months compared with their rental fee.
customer_reviews.author: JH in NE

customer_reviews.title: Could not go fast.
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping the 1200mbps combined would suffice, but it was barely able to sustain 100mbps over the 5ghz band. Only have three devices in the whole house on 5ghz (2 phones, 1 TV) , but it couldn't sustain a decent speed to even just one at a time. Not sure if it didn't have enough processing power to handle the dual-bands, because we have over a dozen devices on 2.4ghz. Had to stick with the cable company's router, which can max out our internet at over 400mbps on 5ghz with all devices connected.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable WiFi Signal
customer_reviews.text: This router has been giving me nothing but trouble ever since I purchased it. I bought it in order to save money on my monthly plan with spectrum, who wanted to charge me $5 to rent a router from them, and the signal has been spotty. For context, I am on spectrum’s 200 MB plan. Furthermore, the router has been turning on and off repeatedly. The WiFi speeds have also been unreliable (even though they’re supposed to be faster.) I am really considering returning to Spectrum’s router as it has caused me a lot of trouble. I am writing this so people think twice before buying this device, especially if it’s for the same Internet Service Provider as me.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Works with Comcast's Xfinity!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. My stepson took only 30 minutes to connect it my ARRIS Surfboard Modem. My Xfinity Adroid "found" our new wifi and I connected to it with no problems. Good Price. I even realized I made a mistake buying the $10.00 Warranty. It comes with a 1 year warranty. Tech like this easily lasts 3 years and considering prices have been dropping, won't cost too much to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Free Polazzo

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for about 6 hrs. After that it would lose connection to the internet avery night. I would have to turn it off and back on to reconnect. Then the speed would drop off and gaming would be ridiculously glitchy. I tried resetting then i had issues connecting to my account. I gave up on it after a week. Probably going to return it. Very unhappy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Thinh T

customer_reviews.title: Problems with DHCP
customer_reviews.text: Both the 2.4 GHz and 5GHz signal is strong throughout the entire house. However, i am not alway able get an IP address on one SSID, while i am able to get it an IP address on the guest SSID. The same thing happens on both 2.4 and 5GHz frequency. I setup enterprises wireless networks for companies since wireless has existed. I know a problem product when i see one.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Rodriquez

customer_reviews.title: Good price and strong signal.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this TP-Link AC1200 Gigabit Smart WiFi Router! Ever since I hooked up this router about 5 months ago it has worked well. I mainly use it hardwired through the Ethernet cable ports. However, I do use the wifi for my printer. The signal is strong and the router and printer connect well. The price was great. The set-up process went very smoothly. FYI: I disconnect my Ethernet cable from my modem when I think there might be a possibility of lightening, because lightening came through the Ethernet cable from the modem to the router and fried my previous modem and router. Expensive lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Evans L.

customer_reviews.title: Full featured router (and acess point too) but unreliable wifi connections.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Archer TPLink routers before and was happy to see the features are all there, and this model is getting firmware updates for security. But the "honeymoon" period didn't last once everyone using the WiFi started complaining about connections being dropped and not reconnecting. It's infuriating! Another issue is the signal strength that has trouble with a couple stud walls. I've seen better signal from Bluetooth. The bargain price is reflects the performance. Pass on this model. Sad to say.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for FaceTime dates during quarantine
customer_reviews.text: This router is a lifesaver. During quarantine, I've been doing many FaceTime dates and have often had my connection interrupted/buffered/etc. throughout the calls. This had also led to the video freezing at awkward moments, like when one of us was talking and had our mouths open/was emoting/etc. This led to frustration on both sides and adversely affected the positive energy/chemistry between us. With the TP-Link router upgrade, my WiFi connection is now four times faster(!) and I have not experienced any buffering or screen freezing. This will prove to be very beneficial as I look to build a relationship and stay connected with others in quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Great signal, awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model that stopped updating software and security patches so I did some research and decided on the tplink ac1200. The other problem with the older model was a "blind" spot in my single story home where the wifi signal dropped dramatically and that was in my bedroom approximately 15 feet from the router. No blind spots with this one...the signal is strong all the way to the end of my driveway 70 feet away! It was fairly easy to set up (had a problem with one of my smart TV's but that was more user error than anything else) and came with everything I needed. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Coulter

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: It was completely unreliable and the signal strength was weak. Some days the signal would drop to 3Mbps for no discernible reason and even resetting it wouldn't fix it. I checked the modem and it would be outputting the full signal. Some days it would just yoyo up and down between a regular signal and 3Mbps for no discernable reason. Some days it worked just fine. Like an idiot I let the return window run out before I got fed up and switched to the wifi router provided by Spectrum, which works perfectly and gives me zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst WIFI router with out a dout....
customer_reviews.text: I had this router for a bout a week and it sucked right from the beginning first no real instructions on how to use it, second the router came with no passwords so until you fix it anybody could log on and burn you 're minuets on the internet, potentially cost you money, second I tried every thing to get this router to work, but no go, it kept droping internet connection and forget about gaming supper slow and downloads it reminded me of my first dial up modem it cept the dial up was faster, differently not a buy take my advise run to something else cheap is sometimes a dead giveaway
customer_reviews.author: R. Jenner

customer_reviews.title: All our devices smoothly streaming so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few weeks ago--giant improvement over old router. No noticeable lag. Very happy for now--will try to update if problems crop up. UPDATE: Liked it so much I bought a second one for home (bought first one for office). Range is not the most powerful out there, but adequate. And when you're in range, it can handle all our devices. I have noticed that videos don't always stream smoothly when I'm at the opposite end of the house, but I could fix that if I wanted to move the router to a central location (instead I just installed a second one of these at the opposite end of the house).
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Earle

customer_reviews.title: Great router but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Got my router and installed it today. It gives a great signal and is well featured for the price. Why the two star review? Because one of the antennae was broken off right out of the box. The thin internal wire that connects it looks like it ripped out. Not going to return it since it still seems to work and meets my needs. Still a substantial upgrade from what i was using, but be careful with it the thing either has poor quality control or is exceptionally fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Spikes

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and reliable.  One glitch fixed with a reset and firmware
customer_reviews.text: Had one issue, but it seemed to be a fluke. Tech support pointed me in the right direction. Stuck a paper clip in the back of my ISP box and the router. Has worked beautifully since. Updated the firmware and it’s even a little better. The interface app for smartphones works great. Was spotty, but after the reset and firmware flash, it has been perfect. One glitch, but I’ve seen stranger and had just relocated my router. Besides that it’s a great product. I’m an IT guru and usually have at least one hiccup with most new products/projects. Overall great product. Powerful, reliable, and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Fisher

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't able to set it up
customer_reviews.text: First off, I have set up plenty of routers over the years. This one has a nice app interface that you can use for the setup, however the unit only connected to the internet for a few minutes, then it asked for a firmware update. After that, it kept telling me that it was not connected to the internet. Tried different cables, different ports, to no avail. I'm returning the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Fortezza

customer_reviews.title: Internet Connection Drops
customer_reviews.text: I’m experienced with setting up routers and overall networking. This router was very easy to setup, the speeds it gave thru WiFi were excellent, and that was not a problem. The biggest problem with this was that the internet connection itself kept dropping multiple times every few hours, and it was not a problem with my ISP. I researched on google, and found out this is a very common issue with this router and there is no fix. Would’ve love to keep this, because of sleek look and incredible WiFi speeds but if there’s no connection it’s worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Nada B

customer_reviews.title: I love it perfect for extending WiFi or splitting Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues setting it up especially rebooting it wouldn’t connect to internet but after fidgeting with the settings I got it to work. There’s a nice app that lets you control the settings and manage devices connected which is nice. I use this on a different floor of my house from the router/modem and it really boosted my signal from 8mbps to 30mbps. Works great to extend your wifi. Ethernet is fast too. Great value and wonderful after setting up.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replaced my almost 10 year old Netgear N300. It was using old signaling system and kept dropping internet. Internet tech was just out to fix another problem and we talked about routers being a bottleneck for speed since I should have been getting around 200 mbps. Just got the Arche4 setup: 30 to 50 mbps on 2.4 ghz and 50 to 100 mbps on 5 ghz. The 100 was ok, but as soon as I walked to the other room it fell to 50. Still an upgrade I suppose, but I was excited to have all the internet speed I am paying for. Looks like it's not going to happen with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Product ok support not worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: This item is ok for what it does. I only have a problem with it does not have any kinda instructions and had to figure out how to reboot it which requires you to sign in to an account or something since by the time I got so pissed off trying to understand or find tech support. I gave myself one more try and getting it to come back up before I trashed it. I well say this tech support is a joke and if this falls out again in the trash and I will just purchase another brand even if it cost twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AC1200 Gigabit Smart WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: Recently I decided to stop renting the router/modem combo from Comcast and purchase a router and a modem. I wanted something decent that was compatible with Comcast, but also inexpensive and without unnecessary features. For the router, I decided on the TP-Link AC1200. It's possible to go cheaper, but it was appealing to have gigabit network speed internally. The router was really painless to set up, everything worked on the first try, and the connections so far have been reliable and fast. (Although I have not attempted to measure them). There are no complaints so far - I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AR1

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly fine but is slower than my older Spectrum (Sage) router
customer_reviews.text: TP-Link’s Tether setup via iOS is easy...or you can set it up via your laptop (and a number of advanced settings can only be set via the network URL). My only issue is that this modem has slower throughput than my previous Sagecom router that Spectrum provided. That’s disappointing but not unexpected for a router this inexpensive. Sometimes turning off QoS helps; othertimes I try disabling MiMo. That said, I’ve had no reliability issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and provides good 5g signal and full 1g Ethernet. The wifi is not as strong as I expected but perhaps that is a function of its location. We are using it as a 2nd router for our upstairs but for some reason the signal drops in far bedroom, which has always had a wifi problem. Ran Ethernet from this router, originated from main cable router in basement, to far bedroom and now that room has 1g Ethernet connection. It is a good economical router.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set settings via application
customer_reviews.text: You know that previous routers had terrible UI and set all settings might get a lot pain. But I was surprised when I got this router - it has friendly UI, I set it for a few minutes. Wow it's incredible! I don't know about strong signal, because I live in small apartment. Anyway my device never lost connection. And nice feature is temporary password for the guest. I use it 1 year, and can strong recommend to buy it. Of course, IT industry changed so fast may be on a market we have new better solution, but for me I found one and don't want search another one for few years at least.
customer_reviews.author: Matvei Iliunov

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 4 months
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for 4 months before it totally stopped working. It was under warranty and TP-Link sent me a replacement. However, the process took over a month - multiple texts between me and their technician to verify that there really is a problem, then I had to register on TP-Link site, and I had to send my old one back (at my expense) before they would send me a refurbished replacement.
customer_reviews.author: W. Chilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router at a budget price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 5 year old TP Link Archer AC1200 router with this TP Link Archer A6 router. It was easy to set up and was up and running out the box in 15 minutes..I had to adjust the 2.4G settings in order to increase the bandwidth. All of my smart devices work without lag. Overall, TP link modems and routers are extremely reliable and reasonably priced... I've used Netgear routers that were priced at over $150 that constantly dropped connections and have failed miserably. However, TP link is by far the best!
customer_reviews.author: D. Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonderfully for me.  Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Used this router (with a new modem) to replace a modem/router combo unit, and this is SOOO much better. Range is good for us, especially compared to the last router. I previously needed two routers to cover the house, and this one covers the house on its own. This device also is much better at handling multiple clients than the old unit. For a family of 6, this is important. I'm sure there are better high dollar options, but you can't go wrong for this price. Only a day in, but early results have me very happy. Tether app is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 24 hours.
customer_reviews.text: I am usually pretty good and finding solutions to technical issues, but I am stumped with this one. The set up is very easy, and everything works great, but after 24 hours, everything connected to my main wifi channel is connected to the router, but state "no internet connection." After resetting the wife router, it works fine again for a day and sometimes two, but then I get the same issue. I don't have any issues with the 5 GHZ channel, but the 2.4 GHZ channel keeps giving me the connected but "no internet connection" issue.
customer_reviews.author: Physics Dan

customer_reviews.title: Poor range and speed
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try a "budget" WiFi router when my 13-month old Netgear Nighthawk R7000 started dropping WiFi connections and required a daily (sometimes 2 or 3 times) reboot. I was very disappointed with the speed. My Netgear routinely hit speeds of 400M on speedtest.net but this TP-link could barely hit 100M. The range was horrendous compared to my Netgear. I returned the TP-Link for a refund and bit the bullet and bought another Netgear Nighthawk.
customer_reviews.author: CEuC

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: Okay, first off, my original router was from one of my fiber was installed about 8 years ago and had been missing an antenna, so it was less than adequate. I was able to set up this router in about 15 minutes including my call to my internet service provider to verify my router. It works amazing in my multi-level house with multiple devices. I will definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K.Turner

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay, but not very impressed...
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay. Nothing special. You get the maximum speed of your internet when you are 1 to 2 feet within the router. However, I noticed that the speed of the internet slows down the farther you get from the router. For the price, this router is good. I would recommend it if you live in a small apartment, but you might want to consider a different router if you live in a big house because its wifi range is not that impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little unit. Simple setup. Highly customizable. You can set up as is from box, or customize features such as gateway settings and just about every aspect you can think of. Surprised that the unit was so inexpensive. I am replacing a 150$ Linksys unit. This one is not rated as good, but seems to be just fine. I had replaced the Linksys router for the 3rd time in like 5 years. So I thought I'd try a different brand. Hopefully this unit will out last the Linksys models.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Godwin

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome once you get it configured to your liking.
customer_reviews.text: It has the ability to shut off the internet at certain times to specific devices without interrupting your personal connection. You know to prevent your kid(s) from playing all hours in the night. There was a weird issue where you could set the time but it would shut their internet off an hour early or two hours later. I updated the wifi router itself and the bug went away. It also comes with an app so you do this from your phone once you configure it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hanshaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I work from home so my employer supplies me with a secure network thing, I have to turn off my WiFi from my ISP’s modem/router and then hook up a separate wireless router for personal use——I figured I try this one because it was so cost effective and a trusted brand I’ve used before. I have 1400 sq ft home and this router supplies a constant reliable signal in all rooms, setup was a breeze and the phone app is pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Chefmiker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget router for upgrading your wifi
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an old Linskys Wifi-N router. The difference is night and day. The Wifi-AC standard is no joke (speeds are great), MIMO is a game-changer that really opens up multi-device streaming in multiple rooms, and beam steering appears to have some positive benefits. The backend interface is easy and the Tether app makes router management easy. If you can snag this router for a good price I highly recommend it over any router your ISP may be providing!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good features, but sometimes doesn't reconnect automatically.
customer_reviews.text: Using it with an Actiontec Verizon modem in bridge mode. Love the QOS capabilities, which the Actiontec doesn't have, and the coverage is much better, but sometimes it doesn't recover on it's own when the DSL drops out, and must be manually reset. On the bright side, it doesn't drop as often than when I was using the Actiontec as the router, but the Actiontec would reboot itself a minute or so after losing connection. My main concern is my security system needs a reliable connection when no-one is home.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This router cannot keep a connection even for an hour without intermittently dropping it (both wifi and wired) which does not work well for working or gaming. Spent 3 days trying to troubleshoot and finding that TP-Link boards are replete with this issue being reported with seemingly no fix. Its not an ISP issue as my old Netgear reconnected to the same modem works perfectly fine. Firmware is up to date as well. Returning this pile of junk.
customer_reviews.author: SchirNYC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router For Price
customer_reviews.text: It weighs 1% of what a router used to weigh back in the early 2010s and emits crazy signal strength. Got it for my business that is running on 300mbps. The jacks on the Router run at 1gbps while Wifi strength runs at 800-900mbps max and it says so on the box! So no this does not have a 1gbps Wifi rate. But it is perfect for those of us who need full speed out of the capacity given from old modems. I used to have 25mbps WIfi, now I'm up to 285mbps. Its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding A+
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. I'm running 7 devices off it with XFinity 130mps speed. Xbox, laptop, cell, 3 security cameras.... 100% flawless. Put Tether iPhone app on and you can change WiFi network name, make guest account. Of course my network name is "FBI Surveillance Van". LOL. Very happy with the product. Had it 2 months now with zero problems. Rock solid. A+
customer_reviews.author: Ben M

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Access Point
customer_reviews.text: Didn't need anything fancy. I have a cat6 ran into my basement that has a sheet metal roof, wifi doesn't reach down here well. Replace my small switch with this baby, set it up as an access point, easy peasy. It's been a few weeks since I set it up, don't remember any hiccups or difficulties. I also work IT, so I can't speak for other users. Basement has good wifi now, which is key to visiting all of my friends islands in [popular quarantine video game title].
customer_reviews.author: GModtheSire

customer_reviews.title: Antennas can NOT be removed.
customer_reviews.text: Despite what TPLINK support says in response to an earlier question about this specific product, the antennas are NOT removable. It's the MAIN REASON I bought this router. In addition, as an access point it can only act as a WIRED ACCESS point and will not act as a wifi repeater or extender. Thank you TPLINK for wasting my day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner123

customer_reviews.title: made the internet steady!
customer_reviews.text: I have Spe**um internet and it seemed as iff my internet would spike and drop frequently, i ordered this and although I don't have the 200 gigs I pay for it seems as if the signal is now solid, way better than before and now my kids can play there video games without issue, I plan on getting a tp link "extender" soon, maybe with one of those my speeds will hit the 200 gigs everywhere in the house. I am getting a sold 100-140 gigs with speed tests, but it isn't dropping, good buy! Will recommend to people with children that need better wifi for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Very solid router ...
customer_reviews.text: ... although I'm just using it as an access point, so I really can't comment on it as a true router. But the setup was easy, the UI is good and the signal is very strong. We have a long ranch style house and I have it at one end of the house and it overpowers the Comcast supplied router even when that router is in the next room and the TP-Link is at the other end of the house, 65-70 ft away with several walls in between. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: OldSchool

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, for those of us not too tech savy- This manufacturer DOES provide a customer service number if you need help setting this up: 866.225.8139. I had no need to use it but found it when I used the smart phone option as a way to setup the router as per the printed instructions. I find no fault in this machine and we all need to realize that it will not speed up your internet that your modem provides. It WILL distribute the signal nicely around the house. I would buy it again and recommend. At the price point it is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied CustomerTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Good average wireless router. Spend a little more and get a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good router. Setup was super easy and is pretty reliable. Even has parental controls available. It isn't the best, but it works. Labeling devices for identification is not there. Listing exceptions to the firewall is difficult to do. Customer service is NOT there. I was transferred 3 times over 40 minute hold, then asked 'what?'. Get a DD-WRT or TOMATO compatible router and use it. This is not one.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kirkley

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to augment an Arris DG-1670A/TW that Spectrum Business installed and which kept dropping connections with 20+ mostly passive devices. The Arris now runs the 2.4 GHz band with one SSID, and the A-6 now runs the 5 GHz band with a different SSID, and no more connection drops from the Arris. Great design, great documentation, great performance, and the iOS Tether app is excellent. I definitely will buy more TP-Link products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Albury

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link Support Not Helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Would not let me sign in to configure. Used manufacturer's login and password multiple times, reset to manufacturer's default and tried again. Told me password wrong. Hard to go wrong when sign in is admin/admin. Never had a chance to use the product. Yes, I know, took me 8 months before unboxing and passed return date, but didn't expect the issue with the password.
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Good Coverage, eliminated drop out and slow speed.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1600 sf split level with the router in the lower level. I was experiencing dropout and slow wireless speed at the far room from the router (previous router Linksys EA4500). Replaced the Linksys router with the TP-Link AC1200 and saw significant wireless speed increase, even at the far room with no drop outs. Note: I upgraded my modem at the same time with an Arris SB1690 (more than doubling my network speed ~ 300 Mbps to ~ 750 Mbps with a wired connection), I went from a best case of ~30 Mbps previously up to ~250 Mbps at the far room. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JohnC

customer_reviews.title: Good setup if you're familiar with technology
customer_reviews.text: I've set up several home networks, a home security camera network, and built several desktop computers. The setup for this wifi router was a snap for me and this model came highly recommended, which is why I ordered it for my grandmother-in-law's house. However, I was summoned by my grandmother-in-law to set it up after she got confused by the setup steps. I hate to generalize across generations, but I can understand where some of the steps are a bit of a struggle for someone new to home networking. However, I would purchase it again in a heartbeat for my own house. Strong signal across the entire building and yards, and easy to secure!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F.

customer_reviews.title: fantastic access point
customer_reviews.text: First off ive been a huge fan of TP-link for along time used many of there products, some have been bad some have been good but this router is really well suited to be an access point, it setup and worked in about 5mins great wifi coverage in a brick house i cannot comment on how this will work as a router but as an AP it is fantastic to expand your wifi network, i only wish the antennas were removable just because i have some nice antennas id like to put on it, runs 24/7 and i have only restarted it once due to my modem having issues and it lost connection once,
customer_reviews.author: Alastorr

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC1200 Gigabit Smart WiFi Router - 5GHz Gigabit Dual Band MU-MIMO Wireless Internet Router, Supports Beamforming, Guest WiFi and AP mode, Long Range Coverage by 4 Antennas(Archer A6), Black
product_meta.description: Style:AC1200 WiFi RouterAC1200 wireless router, Gigabit, dual Band, beamforming, MU-MIMO.
feature_bullets: JD Power Award ---Highest in customer satisfaction for wireless routers 2017 and 2019
Dual band router upgrades to 1200 Mbps high speed internet (300mbps for 2.4GHz + 900Mbps for 5GHz), reducing buffering and ideal for 4K stream
Gigabit Router with 4 Gigabit LAN ports, ideal for any internet plan and allow you to directly connect your wired devices
MU-MIMO technology (5GHz band) allows high speeds for multiple devices simultaneously
AP mode, can be switched to access point mode to share your internet wirelessly
Supports guest WiFi and parental control, an ideal wireless router for home
TP-Link tether app - easily set up and manage your home network at home or remotely
Industry leading 2-year warranty and free 24/7 technical support. Amazon dedicated email

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,501 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
